availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen E. Forrester (Baltimore, Maryland, clerk, printer, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland, clerk, printer, and justice of the peace. Maryland native. Married to Caroline Forrester. Father of Frank Forrester, William Forrester, Birgianna Forrester, and Morris Forrester. Clerk of the Second Branch of the Baltimore City Council in 1856. Member of the American Party. Printer in Baltimore in 1860. Justice of the peace for Baltimore in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore, Ward 19, p. 50.; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore, Ward 20, p. 254; "Organization of the City Council," The Baltimore Sun (Baltimore, Md.), November 20, 1856, p. 1.
